text: abandoned paddy fields empty and burnt
villages for the last two months this
part of northern Rakhine State has been
off-limits to journalists and aid
workers we managed to get someone into
film for us a few weeks ago this village
was full of reinjure Myanmar's unwanted
muslim minority now they're gone
replaced by soldiers driven out by what
the army calls clearance operations
others have described it as ethnic
cleansing even genocide after several
hours driving through abandoned villages
they find some Ranger women the women
say their homes have been burnt down
there are thought to be about 30,000
displaced reinjure many of them have
fled to Bangladesh security was too
tight to make it to any of the most
sensitive reinjure communities but the
Ranger filmed their own testimony and
sent it to us we've blurred the faces
the women's identities of course we
can't verify that what these women say
is true but we know the footage was
filmed in the township of long dong
where other sources allege rape and
killing by the Burmese army among
diplomats here in Yangon the mood is
changing rapidly up until now most of
them had been prepared to give long
sanssouci the newly elected leader here
the benefit of the doubt as she managed
a complex relationship with the powerful
Burmese military what's taken people by
surprise though is that
the issue of rakhine state and the
alleged human rights abuses Miss su Chi
and the army seem to be in complete
agreement
this is a typical update from masucci's
office day after day
it repeats the government position that
soldiers are following the rule of law
that their hinder our burning down their
own homes and that there are no
atrocities being committed
I think the halo of human rights
defender / Aung San su Chi is well and
truly slipped she's a ruthless
politician in a very ruthless
environment she's in a very ruthless
environment dealing with a very ruthless
institution the military and
unfortunately I think the principles
that she has powers for many years have
fallen by the wayside during this
process
Hong sang-soo Chi seen here visiting
Singapore is feeling the pressure at
last week set up a commission to
investigate alleged abuses being
committed by Burmese soldiers it will be
led by another soldier a senior general
so will hardly be independent
establishing the truth about drug kind
state remains a very distant goal jonah
fischer BBC news Myanmar
